item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 12:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Audio Decomposition – open-source seperation of music to constituent instruments (74 points | 12 comments)
2. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (484 points | 52 comments)
3. Andrej Karpathy on learning (should never be fun) (29 points | 8 comments)
4. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (479 points | 153 comments)
5. Mind-Bending Soviet Era Oil Rig City on the Caspian Sea (38 points | 8 comments)
6. Story Structure 101: Super Basic Shit (13 points | 2 comments)
7. Shaderblocks: Block-based image editing (94 points | 16 comments)
8. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (142 points | 21 comments)
9. NYC Subway Station Layouts (212 points | 68 comments)
10. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (217 points | 81 comments)
11. Physical Intelligence's first generalist policy AI can finally do your laundry (128 points | 85 comments)
12. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (128 points | 64 comments)
13. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (367 points | 76 comments)
14. Pushed Authorization Requests (Par) in Asp.net Core 9 (23 points | 4 comments)
15. Measuring keyboard-to-photon latency with a light sensor (2023) (23 points | 8 comments)
16. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (192 points | 107 comments)
17. GenMC: Model checking for concurrent C programs (24 points | discuss)
18. A skeleton made from the bones of at least eight people thousands of years apart (73 points | 18 comments)
19. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (303 points | 46 comments)
20. Hard Cases for a Handle Theory (24 points | 2 comments)
21. When machine learning tells the wrong story (162 points | 15 comments)
22. Grim Fandango (238 points | 77 comments)
23. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (106 points | 11 comments)
24. Ousterhout's Dichotomy (8 points | 1 comment)
25. Texture-Less Text Rendering (197 points | 48 comments)
26. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (202 points | 80 comments)
27. Somebody moved the UK's oldest satellite in the mid 1970s, but no one knows who (140 points | 71 comments)
28. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (539 points | 186 comments)
29. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (184 points | 69 comments)
30. Notes on Guyana (152 points | 110 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 12:25 PM UTC
